entry.title: Undo button doesn‚Äôt work after revealing the toolbar and clicking on it in Mac full screen when "Always Show Toolbar in Full Screen" is disabled
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 126.0.6431.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) 892ba5af9a7bc652eca3b896d2623affd81ef86e-refs/branch-heads/6431@{#1}
OS : Mac Arm (14.3 beta, 13.5 Beta, 11.4,13.4), Mac Intel(10.15.7)
** Prerequisites (flags on/off) - #enable-immersive-fullscreen-toolbar - Enabled
Steps to reproduce : 1. Launch Chrome and enable the above flag 2. Enter full screen and disable "Always Show Toolbar in Full Screen" from View 3. Open any theme from Chrome Web Store 4. Click on Add to Chrome 5. After the theme gets added to Chrome, hover the mouse at the top to reveal the toolbar 6. Try to click on Undo button and observe that it is not clickable
Actual Result: Undo button doesn‚Äôt work after revealing the toolbar and clicking on it in Mac full screen when "Always Show Toolbar in Full Screen" is disabled
Expected Result : Undo button must be clickable
Number of times you were able to reproduce: 5/5 - Yes Bug reproducible after clean install: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible after clearing cache and cookies: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Arm64 Macs: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Intel Macs: Yes/No - Yes Bug reproducible on Chrome for Windows or Linux: No Bug reproducible on Safari/Firefox (When the issue is in Web Content): Firefox: No Bug reproducible on current stable build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Stable #124.0.6367.61 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current beta channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Beta #125.0.6422.4 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current Dev channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Dev #126.0.6423.2 Mac OS : Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4) Bug reproducible on the current Canary channel build (App Version, iOS Version): Yes Chrome Version : Canary #126.0.6431.0 Mac OS :Mac(14.3 Beta,13.5 Beta, 10.15.7, 11.4)
Since, immersive full screen is a new feature, this is a Non-Regression issue. Hence, setting the status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Attaching screencast for reference.
Screencast : https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NjEwNTg5NDAwNDcxOTYxNnw5ZmI0MjRlNS0wYw
Note: 1. Issue able to repro on latest Canary #126.0.6431.0 ,Dev #126.0.6423.2, Beta #125.0.6422.4, and Stable #124.0.6367.61 2. Issue not repro on Win(10,11) and Linux
Thank You..!!

entry.title: Incorrect memory pressure handling in TabHoverCardController
entry.content: TabHoverCardController is using MemoryPressureListener wrong. MemoryPressureListener never fires pressure_level=None events. All the memory pressure logic does not behave as intended.

entry.title: Capture NetLog events in net_unittests
entry.content: Sometimes, writing tests and/or investigating bugs in net_unittests can be tricky and difficult. It would be nice to support the `--log-net-log` command line flag or something similar.

entry.title: Specifying "requires_delegated_availability_check` property in extension feature causes other properties to not be honored
entry.content:
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: all platforms
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/chrome/common/extensions/api/_features.md#requires_delegated_availability_check
Note: Chrome is not responsible for bugs or behavior of individual extensions.
What steps will reproduce the problem?
(1) Create a new feature entry in https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/chrome/common/extensions/api/_api_features.json
(2) Enable the delegated availability check by setting `requires_delegated_availability_check` property to `true`
(3) Add `matches` property and specify an allowlist.
(4) Check the extension API availability.
What is the expected result? Existing properties should also be honored when the delegated availability check is specified.
What happens instead? `matches` property is not considered. When a delegated availability check is present, features only use the handler to check the feature availability even when other properties like `matches` are specified.
This is because `SimpleFeature::IsAvailableToContextImpl` returns early when a delegated handler is specified : https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:extensions/common/features/simple_feature.cc;drc=316185d068318c45f64f36f77bda9f436cf71e23;l=288
Does this issue affect a publicly-available extension? If so, please include its ID here. N/A
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue. N/A

entry.title: Split ServiceWorkerContainerHost and introduce ServiceWorkerClient
entry.content:
For better spec compatibility and concept mapping, to prevent crashes and to implement prefetch cache ServiceWorker support.
Design doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/12_G2S0hI-G54f2c0ZOLtPq_fXZRjWvibGZfndIia1J4/edit#bookmark=id.v3483j1keezl

entry.title: Speedometer3: Improve LayoutSVGShape::CreatePath() performance
entry.content: React Complex DOM (and probably others) spend ~0.8% of time building SVG Paths (mostly from bytestreams, but sometimes from rect?). We can likely add a `HashMap<Something, WeakMember<Path>>` in front of `LayoutSVGShape::CreatePath()`. A lot of these benchmarks might be using the same SVG multiple times.

entry.content:
This template is for filing bugs against Android System WebView. Chrome bugs should be filed at https://crbug.com/wizard.
Android device name:
Android OS version:
Android System WebView version: (Settings > Apps > the 3 dots in the upper right > Show system. On Android N (7.x) through P (9.0), please include Chrome's version. Otherwise, look for "Android System WebView")
Application: (package name or Play Store URL)
Application version:
Steps to reproduce:
1. 2. 3.
Expected result:
Actual result:
Did this work before? (last working WebView version, or N/A)
---
It's especially helpful if you can capture a bug report right after you experience the bug, and attach it here. See https://developer.android.com/studio/debug/bug-report for instructions.
Screen recordings can also be very helpful - see https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb#screenrecord. Please enable "Show taps" in developer settings.

entry.title: On MACOS, initialization SpeechSynthesis takes a lot of time in chrome main thread.
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 126.0.6431.0¬†(Official Build)¬†canary¬†(x86_64) OS version : macOS Version 14.4
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) open chrome with "chrome://tracing/" and start tracing (2) open a web page just call SpeechSynthesis related API and stop tracing (3) The first initialization of SpeechSynthesis can be observed to take up over 300ms of the Chrome main thread.
First get Voices() takes a lot of time in chrome main thread. https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/speech/tts_mac.mm;l=5;drc=59c007a7ad2f034baeffab754f3f5bf109b69cda
On MACOS, can we move the speech synthesizer code to a worker thread, Just like the improvements in Windows. https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2502948

entry.title: How to enable ETW logging on Chrome canary release?
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create custom WPRP profile. 2. Add GUID mentioned in chrome canary ETW manifest file. 3. Use WPR and custom wprp to enable/start logging for benchmark like speedometer 4. Stop logging after benchmark is done execution. 5. Analyze the log using WPA and look for chrome canary events that log events with subtest/js script executed by benchmark to look for window of focus.
# Problem Description I am looking for enabling ETW instrumentation for performance analysis using WPA tool. Tried enabling ETW events using ETW .man file mentioned here: https://chromium.googlesource.com/aosp/platform/external/libchrome/+/37b6860c4fbd6235d09a76026b6456a5e9459b0d/base/trace_event/etw_manifest/chrome_events_win.man however I had not success in enabling logging. I also tried UIForETW tool yet not able to enable events. I am able to log ETW events from MSEdge/Canary release using "C56B8664-45C5-4E65-B3C7-A8D6BD3F2E67". Looking similar options in for chrome canary. Is there procedure verified and documented anywhere?
# Summary How to enable ETW logging on Chrome canary release?
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Feature - Request for new or improved features
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Live Edit can't be undone
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open/create a javascript file in the Sources panel. 2. press the "{}" (Format, historically called "beautify") button below the gutter. 3. Try to undo the change with ctrl-Z and find yourself unable to do so.
# Problem Description Back when the button used to be called "beautify" on hover, the change could be undone, which is helpful if you just want to see what would change, or copy a formatted snippet from eg. a minified file. A lot has changed recently, including the way formatting works, but a simple edit history would be only reasonable to have.
# Summary Live Edit can't be undone
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: LiveEdit simply not working
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Add a folder, containing eg. a simple html which loads a neighboring javascript file, as a workspace in the Sources panel, and open the javascript file for edit. 2. Load the html in the browser tab, wait for the script to be loaded as well. 3. Witness no "green dot" on the icon of the javascript file open in the Sources panel, indicating active Live Edit state, despite the same file having loaded in the Network panel.
# Problem Description When the file contents are the same (plus, in a Nodejs inspector panel's case, the file path needed to match as well), the file open in the Sources panel should be activated for Live Edit mapping to that resource. I have been observing intermittent failures since about version 118 (or ever since a lot of Devtools overhaul updates were trickling down), but at least since v121, it has simply stopped working ever. My suspicion is the auto-formatting feature, which creates a mismatch between the filesystem and the loaded resources at a too early stage, but could be something else.
# Additional Comments I have copied the loaded resource's response from the Network panel and compared it to the file in the Workspace, and they were identical. In the Preview tab of the loaded resource in the Network panel, i see a pretty-printed version of the same file though, which lead me to accuse the auto-formatting updates that I read about in some recent release notes, if i wasn't mistaken.
# Summary LiveEdit simply not working
# Additional Data Category: Developer Tools \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: help learning basics
entry.content:
**NOTE**: Changing the template (or component which causes a template change) may change the access level this bug defaults to and it may no longer be confidential.
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) (2) (3)
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: My apps outside of Google sponsored apps aren't working. Why? What's restricting
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Only play store, play system, and google featured apps are running 2. I see play system and chrome showing cach background 3. My google.com server is being blocked. Please allow so I can receive messages. I'm not sure if cloudflare or aws is restricting
# Problem Description Suddenly, I'm not able to receive web message to my device. My WiFi connection is Xfinity. Why wouldn't I be receiving messages if connection shows excellent. I only utilize Google voice as my main phone number. Please allow my 8888 and 8844 capabilities
Events Proxy DNS Sockets Domain Security Policy Shared Dictionaries HSTS/PKP HSTS is HTTP Strict Transport Security: a way for sites to elect to always use HTTPS. See https://www.chromium.org/hsts. PKP is Public Key Pinning: Chrome "pins" certain public keys for certain sites in official builds. Add HSTS domain Input a domain name to add it to the HSTS set:
Domain: example.com Include subdomains for STS: Query HSTS/PKP domain Input a domain name to query the current HSTS/PKP set:
Domain: www.google.com
Found: static_sts_domain: static_upgrade_mode: DEFAULT static_sts_include_subdomains: false static_sts_observed: 0 static_pkp_domain: static_pkp_include_subdomains: static_pkp_observed: static_spki_hashes: dynamic_sts_domain: www.google.com dynamic_upgrade_mode: FORCE_HTTPS dynamic_sts_include_subdomains: false dynamic_sts_observed: 1713739400.682229 dynamic_sts_expiry: 1800139400.682036 static_sts_domain: static_upgrade_mode: DEFAULT static_sts_include_subdomains: false static_sts_observed: 0 static_pkp_domain: static_pkp_include_subdomains: static_pkp_observed: static_spki_hashes: dynamic_sts_domain: www.google.com dynamic_upgrade_mode: FORCE_HTTPS dynamic_sts_include_subdomains: false dynamic_sts_observed: 1713739400.682229 dynamic_sts_expiry: 1800139400.682036 static_sts_domain: static_upgrade_mode: DEFAULT static_sts_include_subdomains: false static_sts_observed: 0 static_pkp_domain: google.com static_pkp_include_subdomains: true static_pkp_observed: 1713012928 static_spki_hashes: sha256/IPMbDAjLVSGntGO3WP53X/zilCVndez5YJ2+vJvhJsA=,sha256/hxqRlPTu1bMS/0DITB1SSu0vd4u/8l8TjPgfaAp63Gc=,sha256/Vfd95BwDeSQo+NUYxVEEIlvkOlWY2SalKK1lPhzOx78=,sha256/QXnt2YHvdHR3tJYmQIr0Paosp6t/nggsEGD4QJZ3Q0g=,sha256/mEflZT5enoR1FuXLgYYGqnVEoZvmf9c2bVBpiOjYQ0c=,sha256/CLOmM1/OXvSPjw5UOYbAf9GKOxImEp9hhku9W90fHMk= dynamic_sts_domain: www.google.com dynamic_upgrade_mode: FORCE_HTTPS dynamic_sts_include_subdomains: false dynamic_sts_observed: 1713739400.682229 dynamic_sts_expiry: 1800139400.682036
# Additional Comments Please open my ports and remove any app restrictions.
# Summary My apps outside of Google sponsored apps aren't working. Why? What's restricting
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes
